locality: Desert Botanical Garden, Phoenix, Succulent Lath House, Bed A, accession number 19830497 01 01, Chuck Hansen Arid Land Plants, 6538 E. Tanque Verde, Tucson, 19 September 1983

The New York Botanical Garden and University of the Free State, Bloemfontein, Plants of South Africa. Northern Cape. VioolsdriC At the top of Hellskloof pass, enroute rom Peace of Paradise to Eksteensfontein: On gentle to moderate slope of hill in fall sun. In well-drained rocky soil of quartzite gravel. Succulent Karoo. Perennial succulent, 10-25 mm cm high, caespitose. Leaves opposite, glaucous, velvety, united into an obconical body, with triangular top. Old leaves drying into i; which new leaves re-emerge. Flowers single, cobalt yellow, 10 mm across, arising from a cleft in the leaf body. Capsules dark coloured, 5 mm in diam. Native and common when found.
